title: What do critical care nurses want from clinical information systems?

references.title: Basics of Qualitative Research: Grounded Theory Procedures and Techniques.
references.raw: Strauss, A. Corbin, J. (1990) Basics of Qualitative Research: Grounded Theory Procedures and Techniques. Newbury Park CA: Sage.

references.title: Brahms but not necessarily Liszt: the impact of computerised systems on nursing within intensive care.
references.raw: Norrie, P. (2000) Brahms but not necessarily Liszt: the impact of computerised systems on nursing within intensive care. Chapter in Making a Difference. D. Freshwater (editor), University of Nottingham: Nursing Praxis International: 65-76.

references.title: CIS Impact studyunpublished report. Lutheran Hospital
references.raw: Lutheran Hospital (1991) CIS Impact studyunpublished report. Lutheran Hospital 1910, South Avenue, La Crosse, Wisconsin.

references.title: Computer based entry for nurses in the ICU,
references.raw: Bradshaw, K.E. Sittig, D.F. Gardner, M. Pryor, T.A. Budd, M. (1989) Computer based entry for nurses in the ICU, MD Computing 5(5): 274-280.

references.title: How do nurses use their time?
references.raw: Hendrickson, G. Doddato, T. Kovner, C. (1990) How do nurses use their time? Journal of Nursing Administration 20(3)31-37.

references.title: Nurses attitudes towards computerisation in intensive care.
references.raw: Large, W. (1994) Nurses attitudes towards computerisation in intensive care. British Journal of Nursing, 3(11): 558-564.

references.title: Social Research: Issues, Methods and Processes. 2nd edition. Open university press:
references.raw: May, T. (1997) Social Research: Issues, Methods and Processes. 2nd edition. Open university press: Oxford.

references.title: The Discovery of Grounded Theory: Strategies for Qualitative Research.
references.raw: Glaser, B.G. Strauss, A.L. (1967) The Discovery of Grounded Theory: Strategies for Qualitative Research. Chicago: Aldine.

references.title: The Research Interview.
references.raw: Gillham, B. (2000) The Research Interview. London: Continuum.

references.title: Understanding grounded theory: principles and evaluation.
references.raw: Smith, K. and Biley, F. (1997) Understanding grounded theory: principles and evaluation. Nurse Researcher,  4 (3): 17-30.

abstract: Original research using qualitative methods. This found that nurses would be likely to have positive orientation to aspects of information technology which helped them deliver higher quality direct nursing care, a position quite different form that suggested by the predominantly medical technical literature

What do critical care nurses want from clinical information systems?</dc:title><dc:creator>
Norrie, Peter</dc:creator><dc:description>
Original research using qualitative methods. This found that nurses would be likely to have positive orientation to aspects of information technology which helped them deliver higher quality direct nursing care, a position quite different form that suggested by the predominantly medical technical literature.</dc:description><dc:date>
